anitabidari wrote:
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>> anitabidari wrote:
>>> I have heretrix-1.10.2 running on a dual core Linux box with 2.8Ghz
>>> cpu's and 8G memory. Heretrix is often running into an Out of Memory
>>> error. I dont recall seeing this error with an older version of
>>> heretrix v1.8 that I had running for quite sometime.
>>>
>>> I am running it on a 64 bit machine. And the version of java I am
>>> using is j2se_jdk_sun-1.5.0.07. I have the heap size set to 3Gigs
>>> (-Xmx option.). Does anyone have any ideas on how to resolve this?
>>> Should I try running it with a 64 bit JVM, so I can specify a larger
>>> heap? 
>> Were you using the exact same JVM (esp. heap) and Heritrix (esp. 
>> Processors and UriUniqFilter) options in 1.8? How long does it take to 
>> OOME?
>>
>> A problematic issue with our DNS library using an ever-growing
> amount of 
>> cache memory was resolved between 1.8 and 1.10.2, so I would have 
>> expected fewer OOMEs in long-running crawls, rather than more.
>>
>> Some thoughts:
>>
>> (1) Since you have 8GB, a 64bit JVM and larger heap could help --
> but it 
>> tends not help as much as you think, because 64bit object pointers mean 
>> it takes a large heap to hold the same number of objects. (One estimate 
>> I've seen not specific to Heritrix's heap: 40% larger heap needed for 
>> same number of 64bit JVM objects.)
>>
>> (2) Not all OOMEs are really caused by main heap depletion -- some
> other 
>> resource/memory-space depletions also cause OOMEs. Some of these other 
>> depletions can be *worsened* by growing a heap closer to an addressing 
>> ceiling. If you have a OOME that's easy to reproduce quickly, you may 
>> want to try running under a 1.6 JVM -- its OOME errors are more 
>> descriptive, and there are other options for examining the heap (see 
>>
> http://java.sun.com/javase/6/webnotes/trouble/TSG-VM/html/memleaks.html#gbywi)
> 
>> after the OOME.
>>
>> - Gordon @ IA
>>
>>> Yahoo! Groups Links
>>>
>>>
>>>
> 
> Hi Gordon
> Per your recommendation I have downloaded 1.6 JVM and am running the
> crawl. 3G is a lot of memory. What could be causing Heretrix to take
> up more than 3G?

I don't know; the last OOME problem we had was related to the DNS issue 
fixed before 1.10.2.

What is your crawl like -- number of seeds, breadth/scoping, etc. -- and 
how soon does it OOME (in time and number of URIs visited and scheduled)?

- Gordon @ IA
